channel.title: Can't reinstall/ update Monero-Gui
channel.description:
I'm having troubles with upgrading/ updating my Monero GUI wallet. Version 17 was released but I'm still at version 16, whenever I try to install it in order to update it, it's saying monero is already the newest version.
I've done sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get dist-upgrade and sudo apt-get upgrade.
Also is there any way to verify already installed software?

item.title: Can't reinstall/ update Monero-Gui
item.dc:creator: 90WUVLight
item.description:
It takes time for new package to merge, so just download the appimage package from monero site and verify it.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't reinstall/ update Monero-Gui
item.dc:creator: LavenderLevitator
item.description:
Whonix 15 is based on Debian Buster. While the Monero GUI wallet v0.17.1 is now available, this doesn’t mean that it is already packaged ready for you to download/install over apt.
Or rather: v0.17 is still upstream, so you’d have to install it manually or rather wait until it’s packaged.

parallelanonmity:

Also is there any way to verify already installed software?

Almost forgot that one. You probably mean verifying the integrity of the packages installed per apt? dpkg -V can do that. To see how that one works use man dkpg.

For future trouble consider the free support principle.

Read full topic
